results.title: Every minute counts
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of a supervisor who becomes worried by the incidence of absenteeism and tardiness in his department. His superintendent points out many of the causes to him, and he takes steps to remedy them.
results.description: This film tells the story of a supervisor who becomes worried by the incidence of absenteeism and tardiness in his department. His superintendent points out many of the causes to him, and he takes steps to remedy them.

results.title: Every day except Christmas
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Anderson, Karel Reisz, Leon Clore, Ford Motor Company and Graphic Films
results.brief_description: The story of a day’s work at Covent Garden, from the moment when the first lorry arrives in the quiet and shuttered market soon after midnight, through the increasingly busy hours around dawn, until it subsides again into inertia as the last customers, the old flower ladies who sell in the streets at evening, make their modest purchases and depart. Lindsay Anderson’s documentary, a remarkable enterprising example of sponsorship on the part of the Ford Motor Company, has become widely known since it received the Grand Prix at Venice festival. It is a film of enormous technical skill: highly sophisticated poetic passages alternate with candid camera scenes close to life. Its real importance, however, is in its attitude - its intentness upon - the dignity of labour and workers and of the interdependence of our society, of which a market like Covent Garden is a highly significant symbol. Lindsay Anderson’s intention is summed up in the words which precede the title of the film: To Alice and George Bill. And Sid and Alan and George. And Derek and Bill and all the others… this film, about the market at Covent Garden, is affectionately dedicated. Script, Lindsay Anderson. Cinematography, Walter Lassally. Sound recording and editing, John Fletcher. Music, Daniel Paris. (Awards: Grand Prix Venice)

results.title: Every child a winner!
results.creator_credit: Charles F. Holbrook and American Alliance for Health, Physical Education, and Recreation
results.brief_description: Presents a case history of a program which demonstrates the values of individualised movement-based physical education, the Project Health and Optimum Physical Education program. Demonstrates the results of the program which concentrates on children at the elementary grade level. For teacher training.

results.title: Every baby a wanted baby
results.brief_description: A lecture on various methods of planning a family attended by couples with different backgrounds. The basic facts of human reproduction are also related with the use of animation.

results.title: The Ever-changing sky: John Constable 1776-1837
results.brief_description: An appraisal of John Constable, English landscape painter, who lived from 1776 to 1837. Depicts his birthplace and the scenes in Suffolk which inspired many of his paintings. He strove to capture the beauty of nature in his paintings with dramatic and emotional brushwork, and in his freedom and his sense of space and light, he can be seen as the precursor of the plain-air painting of the Impressionists.

results.title: The Ever-changing lowlands
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: For students of Canadian geography, this film shows the characteristics of the Quebec-Ontario region bordering the United States, where most of Canada’s population settled, and where manufacturing and agriculture thrive.

results.title: Eventful Britain [b&w]
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Travel and Holidays Association
results.brief_description: Sets out to show that there is always something on in Britain. Ranges over a calendar of events, crowded with ceremonies and sporting fixtures which are open to all and cost little or nothing to attend. Includes such events as the Brighton Veteran Car Run, the Farnborough Air Show, the Henley Royal Regatta, the FA Cup Final at Wembley and much more.

results.title: Event horse
results.creator_credit: Robin Crane and Robin Crane Films
results.brief_description: Based on Sheila Willcox’s book “The Event horse”. Tells the story of the training of a “green” horse up to the winning of a novice horse trial. Training technicalities are presented in an interesting way, and the whole story of training and competing is designed to give people a better understanding of the purpose and requirements of a horse trial.

results.title: Eve Lambart
results.creator_credit: Margaret Wescott, Edward Le Lorrain and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Film animator Eve Lambart spent over thirty years working at the National Film Board, and now she has retired. This retirement means many things to her: gardening, sewing, baking and preserving, weaving, and even filmmaking in her own animation studio during her “spare” time. Always an individualist, she is enjoying her self-contained new lifestyle to the fullest.

results.title: Europe by train
results.creator_credit: James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Douglas Brown, journalist and traveller, takes us about Europe telling of his experiences of many different countries: Italy, Switzerland, Germany and Spain. Lingering in stations, or riding on some crack continental expresses, he conveys the excitment of travelling abroad and shows how he makes the journey an interesting part of a holiday or a business trip.
